name: Acute Mesenteric Ischemia with Bowel Perforation
chief_complaint: Excruciating abdominal pain that came on suddenly and won't go away
prognosis: Guarded - mortality rates exceed 60% even with prompt intervention. Survivors often require long-term nutritional support and may have permanent digestive impairments.
description: A life-threatening vascular emergency where sudden occlusion of mesenteric blood supply leads to bowel necrosis and perforation. Typically involves superior mesenteric artery embolism or thrombosis. Requires immediate surgical intervention to prevent fatal sepsis.
multiple_choice: Acute Mesenteric Ischemia with Bowel Perforation
